speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: SCENE II. France. Plains in Anjou.

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Enter CHARLES, BURGUNDY, ALENCON, BASTARD OF ORLEANS, REIGNIER, JOAN LA PUCELLE, and forces

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: These news, my lord, may cheer our drooping spirits:

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: 'Tis said the stout Parisians do revolt

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: And turn again unto the warlike French.

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: Then march to Paris, royal Charles of France,

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: And keep not back your powers in dalliance.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Peace be amongst them, if they turn to us;

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Else, ruin combat with their palaces!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Enter Scout

speaker: Scout
text_entry: Success unto our valiant general,

speaker: Scout
text_entry: And happiness to his accomplices!

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: What tidings send our scouts? I prithee, speak.

speaker: Scout
text_entry: The English army, that divided was

speaker: Scout
text_entry: Into two parties, is now conjoined in one,

speaker: Scout
text_entry: And means to give you battle presently.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Somewhat too sudden, sirs, the warning is;

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: But we will presently provide for them.

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: I trust the ghost of Talbot is not there:

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Now he is gone, my lord, you need not fear.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Of all base passions, fear is most accursed.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Command the conquest, Charles, it shall be thine,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Let Henry fret and all the world repine.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Then on, my lords; and France be fortunate!

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Exeunt
